Definition.WordDefinition: Hindoo \Hin"doo\, Hindu \Hin"du\ (?; 277), n.; pl. {Hindoos}or {Hindus}. [Per. Hind[=u], fr. Hind, Hind[=u]st[=a]n, India. Cf. {Indian}.] A native inhabitant of Hindostan. As an ethnical term it is confined to the Dravidian and Aryan races; as a religious name it is restricted to followers of the Veda.

Definition.WordDefinition: Hindu \Hin"du\, n. Same as {Hindoo}. This is now the more commonly used spelling. [1913 Webster +PJC]

Hindu adj : of or relating to or supporting Hinduism; "the Hindu faith" [syn: {Hindi}, {Hindoo}] n 1: a native or inhabitant of Hindustan or India [syn: {Hindoo}, {Hindustani}] 2: a person who adheres to Hinduism [syn: {Hindoo}]
